At 12:08 PM 1/24/01 , Peter Bismuti wrote:
>Are there any standard tests to verify that class is thread safe?

There's no easy way to do verify thread safety with tests, because the race
condition may only happen very rarely, and possibly not at all on the VM
you are using.

Writing thread safe classes is tricky.  Doug Lea, author of "Concurrent
Programming in Java", says they still give him trouble.

A few simplifications that might work for you:

* Do everything in one thread (the Swing approach).
* Immutable classes are always thread safe.
* Classes not reachable from outside the current thread are always thread safe.

For everything else, you're on your own.  Try reading Concurrent
Programming in Java for a good overview of the issues involved.
